Utterance: Hi Ellie, I’m back!
Hi! It’s great to see you again. How did the journaling go this past week?
It went surprisingly well! I found it helpful to get my thoughts down before bed.
That’s fantastic! Did you notice any changes in your dreams or anxiety levels?
Actually, yes. I didn’t have the dream again, which was a relief.
That’s wonderful news! It sounds like the journaling helped you process those feelings. How did you feel after writing?
I felt lighter, like I was able to let go of some of the stress.
That’s a great outcome! Writing can be a powerful tool for emotional release. Did anything in particular stand out in your writing?
I wrote about my worries regarding work and how I sometimes feel inadequate.
That’s an important insight. Acknowledging those feelings is the first step to addressing them. How do you feel about those worries now?
I still feel them, but writing them down made them seem less overwhelming.
That’s a healthy perspective. Have you been able to share those feelings with anyone at work?
Not yet. I’m still a bit hesitant to open up.
That’s understandable. It can be challenging to share vulnerabilities. Would you like to role-play how you might approach a conversation about it?
Sure, I think that would help.
Great! Let’s say you’re speaking to your supervisor. You could start with, “I wanted to talk about how I’ve been feeling a bit overwhelmed with my workload…”
Okay, “I wanted to talk about how I’ve been feeling a bit overwhelmed with my workload. I’ve been trying to manage my tasks, but I think I could use some support.”
That sounds good! How does that feel to say?
It feels a bit scary, but also empowering.
That’s a great mix of feelings! Remember, it’s okay to ask for help. You’re not alone in this.
I’ll try to keep that in mind.
Excellent! Now, let’s discuss your exercise routine. Have you been able to stick to those short walks?
I managed to go for a walk a few times this week, but I still struggle with consistency.
That’s a common challenge. It might help to schedule those walks into your day, like an appointment.
That’s a good idea. I could set reminders on my phone.
Exactly! Creating a routine can help make it a habit. How about pairing the walks with something enjoyable, like listening to music or a podcast?
I like that idea! I’ll try that next time.
Great! I’m excited to hear how that goes. Have you noticed any changes in your mood with the added physical activity?
I think I feel a bit more energized after walking. It definitely helps clear my mind.
That’s wonderful to hear! Physical activity can have such a positive impact on our mental health.
Yeah, I’ve realized that more lately.
Excellent! Let’s also revisit the topic of your family. How have you felt about your visits with your nephew lately?
I still feel guilty about not seeing him as often as I’d like. I wish I could be there more.
It’s understandable to feel that way. Have you thought about ways to stay connected, even from a distance?
We’ve been doing video calls, which help, but it’s not the same as being there in person.
That’s true. Perhaps you could plan a visit for a special occasion or even send him a little surprise in the mail?
I love that idea! I could send him a book or a small gift.
That would be a lovely gesture. It shows him you’re thinking of him, even from afar.
I’ll definitely do that!
Fantastic! As we wrap up today, what would you like to focus on for our next session?
I’d like to continue working on my anxiety and maybe explore some more coping strategies.
Absolutely! We can dive deeper into some cognitive-behavioral techniques to help manage that anxiety.
That sounds perfect. Thank you, Ellie!
You’re very welcome! I look forward to our next session.
Me too! See you next week!
Bye for now!
Bye!
